titles.title: A bill to require the Federal Communications Commission to promulgate rules pertaining to the use of the Global Maritime Distress and Safety System if such System is required on board United States ships.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S4632-4633)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce.

bill.summary: 4/19/1993--Introduced. Directs the Federal Communications Commission, if it requires the use of the Global Maritime Distress and Safety System (GMDSS) on board U.S. ships of more than 1,600 tons, to require that: (1) one individual tested and certified as competent shall be capable of on board maintenance and repair of the GMDSS; and (2) testing and certification standards for radio officers and operators on board such ships be upgraded to include competency standards for at-sea operations, maintenance, and repair of the GMDSS.
